column4: I have a turnkey configured VM, and I'm trying to setup postfix to just relay mail...only problem is that I cannot even telnet into port 25 to test it out...I have opened TCP/25 in the firewall, but it's still denying the connection...anyone have recommendations as to how I can further troubleshoot this?
what's the exact error message you receive?
- could not open connection to the host, on port 25:  Connect failed
the target host is on the local network?
- any suggestions?
i asked if the target host was on the local network; you didn't respond.
so, is it?
- I'm sorry, i missed that.  Yes, the test system & linux system are both within the same VLAN
do other connections proceed normally to the test system?
(ssh, http, etc.)
http & ssh work
can you connect to postfix from the test system itself?
- how would I attempt that?  I only have SSH access to the box, as well as a web interface care of turnkey
can you install telnet temporarily on the test machine?
or hell, just use netcat
- my bad, I have telnet on there, and have tried to connect via port 25
with no luck
same error? the turnkey system came with a firewall up and running?
- yes
time to turn it off, at least for now :-)
or just flush the offending rule
- working on that...figured that's where you were going :)
